member.name: T:Memcached.ClientLibrary.MemcachedClient
member.summary:
This is a C# client for the memcached server available from http://www.danga.com/memcached/.
Supports setting, adding, replacing, deleting compressed/uncompressed and serialized (can be stored as string if object is native class) objects to memcached.
Now pulls SockIO objects from SockIOPool, which is a connection pool. The server failover has also been moved into the SockIOPool class. This pool needs to be initialized prior to the client working. See javadocs from SockIOPool. (will have to be fixed for our C# version. Most of this code is straight ported over from Java.)

member.name: M:Memcached.ClientLibrary.MemcachedClient.Delete(System.String,System.Object,System.TimeSpan)
member.summary:
Deletes an object from cache given cache key, a delete time, and an optional hashcode.
The item is immediately made non retrievable.
Keep in mind: add(string, object) and replace(string, object) will fail when used with the same key will fail, until the server reaches the specified time. However, set(string, object) will succeed and the new value will not be deleted.
member.param: if not null, then the int hashcode to use
member.returns: true, if the data was deleted successfully

member.name: M:Memcached.ClientLibrary.MemcachedClient.Set(System.String,System.String,System.Object,System.TimeSpan,System.Object,System.Boolean)
member.summary:
Stores data to cache.
If data does not already exist for this key on the server, or if the key is being deleted, the specified value will not be stored. The server will automatically delete the value when the expiration time has been reached.
If compression is enabled, and the data is longer than the compression threshold the data will be stored in compressed form.
As of the current release, all objects stored will use .NET serialization.
member.param: if not null, then the int hashcode to use
store this object as a string?

member.name: M:Memcached.ClientLibrary.MemcachedClient.IncrementOrDecrement(System.String,System.String,System.Int64,System.Object)
member.summary:
Increments/decrements the value at the specified key by inc.
Note that the server uses a 32-bit unsigned integer, and checks for underflow. In the event of underflow, the result will be zero. Because Java lacks unsigned types, the value is returned as a 64-bit integer. The server will only decrement a value if it already exists; if a value is not found, -1 will be returned.
TODO: C# has unsigned types. We can fix this.
member.param: if not null, then the int hashcode to use
member.returns: new value or -1 if not exist

member.name: M:Memcached.ClientLibrary.MemcachedClient.Get(System.String)
member.summary:
Retrieve a key from the server, using a specific hash.
If the data was compressed or serialized when compressed, it will automatically be decompressed or serialized, as appropriate. (Inclusive or)
Non-serialized data will be returned as a string, so explicit conversion to numeric types will be necessary, if desired
member.returns: the object that was previously stored, or null if it was not previously stored

member.name: P:Memcached.ClientLibrary.MemcachedClient.EnableCompression
member.summary:
Enable storing compressed data, provided it meets the threshold requirements.
If enabled, data will be stored in compressed form if it is longer than the threshold length set with setCompressThreshold(int)
The default is that compression is enabled.
Even if compression is disabled, compressed data will be automatically decompressed.
member.value: true to enable compuression, false to disable compression

member.name: P:Memcached.ClientLibrary.MemcachedClient.CompressionThreshold
member.summary:
Sets the required length for data to be considered for compression.
If the length of the data to be stored is not equal or larger than this value, it will not be compressed.
This defaults to 15 KB.
member.value: required length of data to consider compression

member.name: P:Memcached.ClientLibrary.SockIOPool.Failover
member.summary:
Gets or sets the failover flag for the pool.
If this flag is set to true and a socket fails to connect, the pool will attempt to return a socket from another server if one exists. If set to false, then getting a socket will return null if it fails to connect to the requested server.

member.name: P:Memcached.ClientLibrary.SockIOPool.Nagle
member.summary:
Gets or sets the Nagle algorithm flag for the pool.
If false, will turn off Nagle's algorithm on all sockets created.

member.summary: Gets or sets the hashing algorithm we will use.

member.name: T:Redissharp.SockPool
member.summary:
This class is a connection pool for maintaning a pool of persistent connections to memcached servers.
The pool must be initialized prior to use. This should typically be early on in the lifecycle of the application instance.

member.summary: Factory to create/retrieve new pools given a unique poolName.

member.summary: Sets the list of all cache servers

member.summary: Sets the list of all cache servers

member.name: M:Redissharp.SockPool.OriginalHashingAlgorithm(System.String)
member.summary:
Internal private hashing method.
This is the original hashing algorithm from other clients. Found to be slow and have poor distribution.
member.returns: hashcode for this string using memcached's hashing algorithm

member.name: M:Redissharp.SockPool.NewHashingAlgorithm(System.String)
member.summary:
Internal private hashing method.
This is the new hashing algorithm from other clients. Found to be fast and have very good distribution.
UPDATE: this is dog slow under java. Maybe under .NET?
member.returns: hashcode for this string using memcached's hashing algorithm

member.name: M:Redissharp.SockPool.IsConnected(System.Net.Sockets.Socket)
member.summary: Gets whether or not the socket is connected. Returns true if it is.

member.name: M:Redissharp.SockPool.CreateSocket(System.String)
member.summary:
Creates a new Socketobj for the given server.
If server fails to connect, then return null and do not try again until a duration has passed. This duration will grow by doubling after each failed attempt to connect.
member.returns: Socketobj or null if failed to create

member.name: M:Redissharp.SockPool.GetSock(System.String)
member.summary: Returns appropriate Socketobject given string cache key.

member.name: M:Redissharp.SockPool.GetSock(System.String,System.Object)
member.summary:
Returns appropriate Socketobject given string cache key and optional hashcode.
Trys to get Socketfrom pool. Fails over to additional pools in event of server failure.
member.param: if not null, then the int hashcode to use

member.name: M:Redissharp.SockPool.GetConnection(System.String)
member.summary:
Returns a Socketobject from the pool for the passed in host.
Meant to be called from a more intelligent method which handles choosing appropriate server and failover.
member.param: host from which to retrieve object
member.returns: Socketobject or null if fail to retrieve one

member.name: M:Redissharp.SockPool.AddSocketToPool(System.Collections.Hashtable,System.String,System.Net.Sockets.Socket)
member.summary:
Adds a socket to a given pool for the given host.
Internal utility method.
member.param: host this socket is connected to

member.name: M:Redissharp.SockPool.RemoveSocketFromPool(System.Collections.Hashtable,System.String,System.Net.Sockets.Socket)
member.summary:
Removes a socket from specified pool for host.
Internal utility method.

member.name: M:Redissharp.SockPool.ClearHostFromPool(System.Collections.Hashtable,System.String)
member.summary:
Closes and removes all sockets from specified pool for host.
Internal utility method.

member.name: M:Redissharp.SockPool.CheckIn(System.Net.Sockets.Socket,System.Boolean)
member.summary:
Checks a Socketobject in with the pool.
This will remove SocketIO from busy pool, and optionally add to avail pool.
member.param: add to avail pool if true

member.name: M:Redissharp.SockPool.CheckIn(System.Net.Sockets.Socket)
member.summary:
Returns a socket to the avail pool.
This is called from SockIO.close(). Calling this method directly without closing the Socketobject first will cause an IOException to be thrown.

member.name: M:Redissharp.SockPool.ClosePool(System.Collections.Hashtable)
member.summary:
Closes all sockets in the passed in pool.
Internal utility method.

member.name: M:Redissharp.SockPool.Shutdown
member.summary:
Shuts down the pool.
Cleanly closes all sockets. Stops the maint thread. Nulls out all internal maps

member.name: M:Redissharp.SockPool.StartMaintenanceThread
member.summary:
Starts the maintenance thread.
This thread will manage the size of the active pool as well as move any closed, but not checked in sockets back to the available pool.

member.name: M:Redissharp.SockPool.SelfMaintain
member.summary:
Runs self maintenance on all internal pools.
This is typically called by the maintenance thread to manage pool size.
